docs.lead_paragraph: Drugstore retailer Walgreen Co's Chief Financial Officer, Wade Miquelon, and another top executive lost their jobs after a $1 billion forecasting error in the company's Medicare-related business, the Wall Street Journal reported.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hackers who stole the personal data of about 4.5 million patients of hospital group Community Health Systems Inc broke into the company's computer system by exploiting the "Heartbleed" internet bug, making it the first known large-scale cyber attack using the flaw, according to a security expert.

docs.lead_paragraph: The testimony also tried to counter a prosecution contention that money woes made Bob McDonnell and his wife susceptible to cash offerings while he was governor.

headline.seo: Bob McDonnell’s Sister Testifies at Corruption Trial in Virginia
headline.main: Sister and Wife of Ex-Governor Become Focus in Virginia Trial
headline.print_headline: Sister and Wife of Ex-Governor Become Focus in Virginia Trial

docs.abstract: Defense lawyers in corruption trial of former Virginia Gov Bob McDonnell are attempting to portray him as an amiable innocent who was led astray by his overbearing wife and sister.
docs.snippet: The testimony also tried to counter a prosecution contention that money woes made Bob McDonnell and his wife susceptible to cash offerings while he was governor.

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's largest private prison company, Corrections Corp. of America, has paid more than $8 million in back wages and benefits to current and former employees guarding federal inmates at a prison in California City, officials with the U.S. Department of Labor said Tuesday.

docs.abstract: A home health aide cannot sue a couple with dementia for an injury sustained while caring for them, the California Supreme Court has ruled.

docs.lead_paragraph: After promising not to withhold government information over "speculative or abstract fears," the Obama administration has concluded it will not publicly disclose federal records that could shed light on the security of the government's health care website because doing so could "potentially" allow hackers to break in.

docs.lead_paragraph: The City Council will vote on whether to give school bus companies $42 million to raise the salaries of experienced drivers.

headline.main: School Bus Drivers May Receive More Pay From New York
headline.print_headline: Council Vote Could Give Bus Drivers More Pay

docs.abstract: New York City Council, with Mayor Bill de Blasio's support, is planning to vote to give $42 million to school bus companies to raise salaries of experienced drivers; move is part of effort to reverse some of the policies instituted under former Mayor Michael R Bloomberg that led drivers to strike in 2013.
docs.snippet: The City Council will vote on whether to give school bus companies $42 million to raise the salaries of experienced drivers.
